page.title: 14Religion in our D-block #2
page.content: St.Michael's is the Catholic Church, which was built in 1953. Its beliefs are everything that the Lord taught when he was on earth. On a Sunday the church has 3 masses,at 9.am, 11.am, and 7.pm. A mass is a reading from the Scripture and some prayers connected with the Last Supper. Every week day there is a mass at 10.am except Tuesday, when it is held at 7.pm. Thursday is Corpus Christi, which is the Feast of the Body and Blood of Christ and a Holyday of Obligation. Father Walsh hears confession twice a day except Sunday. Although there are more Protestants than Catholics in our D-block there is better attendance at mass than at Protestant church services. St.Michael's has a regular congregation of just over 500 worshippers.
